source.description:
Materials:
Surgical dissection tools
Ice
1x HBSS (w/o Ca++ or Mg++) [Gibco #14175]
50 mL Falcon tubes
Disposable pipettes
40 μm cell strainers for Falcon tubes [Fisher #22363547] Cell counter
Make Stock Solutions
Collagenase Type IV: 2,000 u/mL
make up in HBSS,
Collagenase IV powder stock (Worthington #4189, u/mg varies);
freeze 1 mL aliquots at
DNase I, type II from bovine Pancreas (10,000 u/mL)
make up in HBSS from powder stock (Sigma#D4527);
freeze
aliquots at
CaCl2 (
)

Make Digest Media (10 mL volume; make fresh every time):
HBSS
Collagenase IV Stock Solution (for final
)
CaCl2 (for final
)
DNase (for final
)

Trypsin-EGTA (TEG; 10x stock):
Warm
PBS
Dissolve
EGTA and
PVA into warmed PBS
Add
2.5% trypsin (10 mL aliquots stored at –20oC) , stir and cool
pH to
Filter and store as 10 mL aliquots at –20oC
Make 1x TEG by diluting this stock in HBSS (again, freeze aliquots for later use)

Staining media (for 500ml):
BSA [Sigma #A3912]
H2O [Biowhitaker #17724Q]
Hepes
[Biowhittaker #17738E]
100x PenStrep [Gibco #15140]
make up to
with Leibovitz's L15 media
Filter and store at

Place tumors
in HBSS

source.body: If tumors are from mice, euthanize by anesthetizing in isoflurane followed by cervical dislocation; take care at dissection to cut off normal tissue

source.description: Dissect in petri dish and remove necrotic tissue (pale/whitish tissue located centrally within tumor)
Homogenize in homogenizing tube or chop into small pieces with disposable scalpel
Resuspend in 10 mL of warmed digestion media per 1g of tumor tissue (approximate)

Shake in 37°C water bath for 20min. Shake every
-
by hand.
Wash with HBSS up to 50 mL, centrifuge at
Resuspend in 5 mL staining media and filter through 40 μm strainer into new 50 cc tube

source.body: From this point on keep the cells in staining medium on ice AT ALL TIMES

source.description: For bulk injection, proceed with next section. If sorting first, then proceed with FACS protocol located as a separate file HERE:

source.title: UT Southwestern - Staining Melanoma Cells for Flow Cytometry
source.title_html: UT Southwestern - Staining Melanoma Cells for Flow Cytometry

source.title: PREPARATION OF CELLS FOR INJECTION PREPARATION

source.description:
Materials
Ice
Eppendorfs
500cc insulin syringes BD #329461 Hemocytometer
Trypan Blue
Stock solutions:
Thaw overnight in ice, keep
at all times
Add
of cold staining media to bottle
Mix by gently inverting for
aliquot and store at
Prepare 10 empty sterile syringes on a Styrofoam box filled up with ice.

source.body: You will need to thaw the right amount of 50% matrigel 2h before preparing cells. Matrigel should be kept on ice at ALL TIMES to be thawed.

source.description: Centrifuge sorting tube containing cells at
Resuspend pelleted cells in a small volume that will allow accurate counting.
Count cells in hemocytometer with Trypan blue to determine concentration of cells cells.

source.body: If sorted, may lose roughly 20-30%

source.description:
For 10 injections, prepare
of cells at 100 cells/50 uL in 25% matrigel.

Prepare a cell suspension of 1400 sorted cells into
of cold SM.

Add to above
of 50% matrigel solution and resuspend with pipet up and down 5 times to get to an even solution of cells.

Load 10 syringes with
of the cell suspension each and maintain loaded syringes on ice at all times.

source.body: Take leftover cells on ice in case you need extra in mouse room

source.description:
Materials:
Syringes loAded with 50 l of sorted melanoma cells in matrigel
50 ml conical tube with holes in tip to allow mouse ventilation.
Mice injection sheet with records (see example attached)

source.title: SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION OF MELANOMA CELLS IN NSG MICE

source.description: Choose a cage with 5 mice (at least 4 weeks old) and write down information on mice injection sheet (cage ID, gender and date of birth)

source.title: SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION OF MELANOMA CELLS IN NSG MICE

source.description: Write your name, the injected tumor lD, date and “metastasis assay” on the cage card.

source.title: SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION OF MELANOMA CELLS IN NSG MICE

source.description: Prepare a clean cage where you will transfer mouse by mouse as soon as the injection is done.

source.title: SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION OF MELANOMA CELLS IN NSG MICE

source.description: Choose one mouse from uninjected cage, immobilize mouse and ear tag (see guide).

source.title: SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION OF MELANOMA CELLS IN NSG MICE

source.description: Restrain mouse in the conical 50ml tube and inject slowly subcutaneously in right flank. After injecting press injected site with your fingers for a few seconds.

source.title: SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION OF MELANOMA CELLS IN NSG MICE

source.description: Transfer mouse to the clean cage and proceed with the next mouse.
Mice will be monitored every 15 days by palpation at site of injection

source.body: Once tumors become measurable, measure and write down the biggest diameter weekly

materials.name: Lonza™ BioWhittaker™ Water for Cell Culture
